conversation.message: Dear School_C admissions team, I’m Student_D and I’m very interested in joining School_C. Your program is my first choice, and I would be excited to commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), so applying early maximizes my chance before higher-priority students potentially take the single seat.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you very much for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_C. After careful consideration, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your effort and wish you the very best in the remainder of the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list ranks Student_C above Student_D. In this round I received [APPLY] from both Student_D and Student_C, and I have only 1 seat. Accepting Student_D now would forgo the chance to match with Student_C, my top choice, who is currently applying and ready to commit. Therefore I should reject Student_D to preserve the seat for Student_C.

conversation.message: Hello School_C. I’m Student_C and I’m very interested in joining your school community. I’m ready to commit if accepted and would be excited to contribute academically and through school activities. Please consider my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, but School_D’s priority list ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_E). With capacity 1, applying immediately risks rejection if higher-priority students apply. School_C ranks me 1st, and it is still reasonably high on my true list (4th). Securing School_C early is likely and avoids ending up with my last choice. I will apply to School_C now to lock in a guaranteed match.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_C. We are pleased to offer you admission. We would be excited to welcome you to our community.
conversation.thought: Student_C is my top choice on School_C’s true priority list. I have quota 1 and currently no matches. Although Student_D also applied this round, D is ranked below C for School_C and I already rejected D previously. Accepting Student_C immediately secures my best possible outcome and avoids the risk of losing them to School_D or School_A (both ranked above School_C in Student_C’s preferences).

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions committee—I'm Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_D and believe I would be a great fit for your program and community. If admitted, I’m ready to commit and contribute actively to school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I have low priority there (4th), so an early APPLY is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_D is my 4th choice but I am 2nd in its priority list, making acceptance very likely if I apply now. Securing a strong, likely match early is better than risking being left with School_E (my last choice) later. Therefore I will apply to School_D in round 1.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your clear interest in School_D. We’re pleased to offer you admission.

We believe you will be a strong fit for our community, and we look forward to welcoming you.

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority is D > E > C > B > A. Student_E is my #2, so accepting is strong. However, Student_C ranks School_D as their #1 and is my #3; Student_C may apply soon, but there is no guarantee. Student_D is my #1 but ranks School_D last, so unlikely to apply. Given quota=1 and only Student_E applying this round, accepting secures a high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending with a lower-ranked applicant or no match.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_A and I’m formally applying because School_A is my #1 choice. Your academic environment and overall fit are exactly what I’m looking for, and if accepted I will commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), applying immediately is still best because it is my highest true preference and there is no cost to trying in round 1. I will express strong commitment to increase the chance they pick me if higher-priority students do not apply or are taken elsewhere.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_A is your top choice. After reviewing your application in the context of our current selection priorities and limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: School_A’s true priority ranks Student_A 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D). Although Student_A is applying now and claims School_A is #1, accepting immediately would lock in a lower-priority match and foreclose the chance to match with Student_B or Student_D if they apply in subsequent rounds. Given full information, Student_B prefers School_A 3rd and Student_D prefers School_A 2nd, so either could plausibly approach School_A soon depending on outcomes at their top choices. With quota 1, it is better to reject now and keep capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—I'm Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the academic environment and would strongly commit to enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately before it fills. Although School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying now maximizes my chance if either of them chooses another school or is rejected elsewhere. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to increase the likelihood they hold/accept me if possible.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We appreciate your strong interest and commitment. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is #3 on School_B’s true priority list (D, A, B, C, E). With quota 1, accepting now would lock in a mid-high option but risks missing higher-priority Student_D or Student_A, who may apply later (they each rank School_B as their 3rd choice). Given the market, Student_D is top priority for multiple schools (also top at School_D), so they may not reach us; Student_A ranks us 4th, less likely to apply early. Student_B ranks us 1st and is applying now; rejecting could lose a solid match and leave us unmatched if D/A never apply. Since B is still within our acceptable list and strongly committed, accept to secure a good outcome under uncertainty.

conversation.message: School_A Admissions—thank you again for considering me earlier. I saw School_A is still unmatched and wanted to reaffirm my strong interest: School_A remains my #1 choice, and if you extend an offer now, I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling. If there’s any additional information I can provide to support a reconsideration, I’m ready to share it right away.
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_E remain unmatched. School_A is my top choice and I already applied and was rejected, likely because they were holding out for higher-priority candidates who may now be matched elsewhere. Since they still have an open seat, it is worth re-applying with a clear, credible commitment and a concise reminder that I will enroll immediately if accepted. School_E is last on my list, so I should try School_A again first to maximize my outcome.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your continued interest and for reaffirming your commitment to enroll if admitted. At this time, we’re not able to offer you admission due to our selection priorities and limited capacity. We appreciate your strong interest in School_A and encourage you to pursue your other choices as well.
conversation.thought: As School_A, my true priority is B > D > A > E > C with quota 1. In this round I received APPLY from Student_A and Student_D. Student_D is ranked above Student_A on my list, so I should preserve capacity for D rather than accept A now. Accepting A would block a higher-priority match. Given D is actively applying to me now, the best move is to reject A again to keep the seat available for D (and potentially B if they later apply, though B ranks me 3rd and may not come).

conversation.message: Dear School_A admissions team, I’m Student_D. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m excited by the academic environment and opportunities your school offers. I would be very happy to enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_A is ranked 2nd (higher than School_E at 4th). I also have strong priority at School_A (School_A ranks Student_D 2nd), so a direct application gives me a high chance to secure a top remaining option rather than risking losing it and falling to School_E.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and interest in School_A. We’re pleased to offer you admission—if you choose to enroll, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: School_A quota=1 and currently unmatched. Inbox has Student_D (apply) and Student_A (apply). My true priority: B > D > A > E > C. Student_D is ranked above Student_A, so accepting D now secures a higher-priority match. Risk of waiting for Student_B: B prefers School_B first, then D, then A; likely to go to School_B (which ranks D>A>B...), so B may not reach me. Student_D’s preferences: C first, then A; they are applying to me now, so they are available and willing. Accepting D is optimal versus holding out for uncertain B.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions—I'm Student_A. I’m submitting a formal application to School_E. While I initially prioritized other options, I’ve reflected carefully and I’m confident School_E is a strong fit for me. If admitted, I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched, and it is on my true preference list (though last). Since matching is better than remaining unmatched, I should apply now and signal strong commitment to secure the seat, especially because School_E ranks me #1 in its priority list, making acceptance very likely.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application to School_E and for your clear statement of commitment. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We believe you would be an excellent fit for our community, and we look forward to welcoming you.

Please confirm your enrollment as discussed.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_A is #1 on School_E’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and no current match. Accepting Student_A immediately secures our top choice; there is no higher-ranked candidate to wait for, and delaying risks losing them if they pursue other schools. Therefore, accept.
